title: Kuska Biryani | Plain Biryani | Lunch Recipe
content:
Main Course: Rice variety| Kuska Biryani (Veg) Servings: 2 Duration: 30 minutes  Kuska is a plain Biryani which is infused with Indian flavours and spices. This is a quick biryani you can make it for lunch or party time or at occasion, basically it's plain right, so it goes well with any Indian gravy curry 🍛 or you can serve it with Onion Salan or mild sour and sweet Cucumber 🥒 Raita. Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Basmati Rice - Long grain rice - 200 grams
  • Onion - 1 medium - sliced
  • Tomatoes - 2 medium - chopped
  • Mint leaves - 20
  • Coriander leaves - 1/2 cup - chopped
  • Oil - 1 tb sp
  • Ghee - 1 tb sp
  • Red chilly powder - 1 tsp
  • Salt - 1 1/2 tsp
  • Garam Masala Powder - 1/2 tsp
  • Cloves - 2
  • Cinnamon - 2 small sticks
  • Green Cardamom - 2
  • Star anise - 2
  • Bay leaves - 2
  • Ginger-garlic Paste - 1/2 tb sp
  • Green chillies paste - 1/2 tb sp
  • Water - 400 ml
Procedure:
  • Heat tawa over medium to high heat
  • Add oil & ghee
  • Add cloves, cinnamon, Cardamom, Bay leaves, green chillies paste and onion
  • Saute 2 minutes and add ginger-garlic paste
  • Mix well and add tomatoes
  • Saute a minute and cover with lid and cook 3 minutes
  • Next add salt, turmeric powder, red chilly powder and Garam masala powder.. Mix well
  • Saute 1 minute and add water
  • Cover with lid ... let water boil
  • Add rice, gently mix and close with lid
  • Cook 12-15 mins
  • Turn off heat and serve hot with any gravy curry
  • Happy cooking 🙂 & Have a great day
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust spices according to taste
  • If you're in diet skip oil and use ghee
  • I cooked Biryani in non-stick deep fry pan, if you wish to make in pressure cook, it's yes you can do for one whistle 🙂
  • If you doesn't like plain Biryani, you can add small amount of peas and carrot.. it's completely optional
